title: Jamie Carragher and Gary Neville go mad while on commentary duty for United-Liverpool
text:
Jamie Carragher and Gary Neville made it very clear where their loyalties lie in a hilarious clip filmed in the commentary box at Old Trafford.

The outspoken pair - famous for their time at Liverpool and Manchester United respectively - were both on commentary duty as their old clubs met on Sunday.

During the match, Sky Sports was not only filming the action on the pitch but also the reaction of their pundits off it, and the reaction was certainly entertaining.

The spoils are shared at Old Trafford!



Who will be the happier between @GNev2 and @Carra23?



VAR controversially upholds Rashford opener and disallows Mane strike before Lallana leveller 👇 — Sky Sports Premier League (@SkySportsPL) October 20, 2019

Jamie Carragher (left) and Gary Neville were on commentary duty for Sky Sports on Sunday

When Manchester United opened the scoring, Neville (right) could not hold in his happiness

There are no doubts as to who both Carragher and Neville wanted to win the game, and they both openly celebrated when their side scored in the 1-1 draw.

First it was Neville's turn to fist-pump as Martin Tyler commentated on Marcus Rashford's opening goal, before he readjusted his headphones and jumped straight back into work mode with Carragher alongside him.

With the match approaching the latter stages, it was ex-Liverpool centre back Carragher's turn to celebrate as Adam Lallana levelled things up.

Carragher got his own back later on when Liverpool netted, celebrating into the camera

Their hilarious reactions were filmed and uploaded to social media, where fans went wild

With Neville still alongside him, Carragher looked straight into the camera to celebrate wildly, as Neville sighed in the background before taking a sip of water.

The result ended Liverpool's 17-match winning streak in the Premier League, with a 1-1 scoreline the final result at Old Trafford.

There was plenty of social media reaction to Neville and Carragher's responses too, with one user writing: 'Fair play to both. There is a rightful respect and I applaud it.'

Another noted: 'Both reactions are great. Muted but ecstatic.'

Marcus Rashford opened the scoring for Manchester United in the first half at Old Trafford
